document_title: What disease is indigestion? Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Indigestion is a condition of pain and discomfort in the abdominal area that occurs after eating, due to problems with the digestive process in the stomach. Symptoms experienced in each person are often not completely the same, appearing often or occasionally depending on the case.
This is not a specific disease, sometimes it is a symptom of a medical problem. Most indigestion symptoms usually improve significantly after lifestyle changes and medication. In some severe cases, this condition can be a warning sign of an underlying digestive disease that requires prompt treatment.
Symptoms of indigestion usually appear within a few minutes to a few hours after eating. In fact, the stomach needs 3 - 5 hours to completely digest the food consumed, then move it to the intestines. During that time, the pancreas and gallbladder send fluids and enzymes to the stomach to support this activity. These are organs in the epigastric region - where indigestion symptoms often occur.
People with indigestion often have stomach pain after eating
